file_content.text: We heard battle. The door was barred. Gaden-Ko--honored one, are you well?
We're a bit shaken, but everything's fine.
He's alright.
I am well. Thank you.
This woman needs to be taken into custody.
I have a prisoner.
I could have used your help.
Where were you?
I apologize.
We have had no Sith prisoners. Her fate is sealed.
What's the penalty for endangering a Mystic's safety?
She did threaten a Mystic.
She leaves Voss-Ka.
If we imprison Sophia, her master will find a way to ensure her death.
The First Son will kill her.
He will not. She leaves Voss-Ka.
Is small payment for this.
That's all? What's your punishment for genocide, a stern talking-to?
Oh, come on. I hand out worse punishments for sloppy dress!
Not very inventive.
Jenar-Sei, you can't let her get away with this.
She takes the Step of Harmony. Down, from the mountain. Leaves Voss-Ka forever.
Jenar-Sei, throwing someone to their death is barbaric.
Over the cliff? Unacceptable!
It is the law. She knew.
Yes. I did. Enjoy your moment of victory, Jedi. It will be fleeting.
I must respect your customs.
If that is your law.
Maybe she'll have time to find peace on the way down.
Sounds good to me.
Goodbye, Jedi. Enjoy your victory. You won't have many more.
Take her to the Nightmare Lands and shut her in the ruins. Without the protective ritual.
Throw her in the Dark Heart.
Outsider mercy. We will do so.
Madness, then? A... fair price for failure. Goodbye, Jedi. I'll be thinking of you.
We return when all is done.
You're... stronger than you look.
I understand now. You're one of the Emperor's Children, like Blaesus.
You're a Child of the Emperor.
I bear that honor, yes.
What were your plans for Gaden-Ko, Sophia?
You wanted Gaden-Ko. Why?
Those steeped in the dark side often mistake understatement for weakness.
Sith often make that error.
So it would seem.
I intended the pilgrimage to truly test Gaden-Ko. Power, or death--hopefully yours.
The First Son will kill me for failing, but it doesn't matter. I've known the perfect enlightenment of serving the Emperor.
Tell me the First Son's name.
Who is the First Son?
Come with me. Let me save you from him.
I can free you.
But who will save you?
One cannot become enlightened while surrounded by darkness.
Enlightened? A Sith?
Yet I have knowledge you don't.
You don't know who the First Son is. I'll share a little secret. Neither does he.
You see, Jedi, some Children never know their true nature. They sleepwalk through life, until the Emperor wakes them.
The First Son serves the Emperor, then returns to normal, unaware. A politician, a soldier... maybe one of your allies.
How can the First Son commit such acts, and not be aware of it?
He must know his true nature.
The mind is malleable. We accept, we explain away.
Keep going. Tell me everything about him.
I want more information.
I thought Jedi learned to be content with what you have.
This is a lie.
Do you sense deceit? I have nothing left to lose.
I trusted. I am betrayed.
I'm sorry, Gaden-Ko. I wanted to see you exalted, at the Emperor's right hand. But you chose the Republic. I can't save you.
Hello again, Jedi. I managed to get away from the embassy for a minute.
Gaden-Ko, congratulations. I knew you could do it. And now you're leaving?
Gaden-Ko may lead his people into the galaxy, and the Republic.
Other Voss may join him.
What a wonderful idea.
But I'm afraid I can't allow it.
I tried to save Doctor Kerrian's people in the Nightmare Lands, but we were mostly too late.
About the research team...
Yes, that didn't quite go as planned.
So I made other arrangements.
I'm sorry, Ambassador, we don't have time to chat.
Yes. Goodbye.
Just one moment, Jedi.
We have unfinished business.
My friend Sophia?
It's alright, Gaden-Ko. Your true destiny is just beginning. When the Jedi is dead, I'll explain everything.
Jedi? It's Sophia Farash, the Republic ambassador. We spoke in Voss-Ka?
It's good to hear your voice, Ambassador.
Hello again.
I'm glad you're both alright. Hello, Gaden-Ko. I heard what happened to your family. I'm so sorry.
I seek its meaning.
I remember. Can I help you?
Do you need something?
Sorry, a lot has happened since I left the capital.
I don't recall.
My friend. I have stories.
I look forward to them. And I'm so sorry, about your family.
Jedi, of course Gaden-Ko's pilgrimage is important, but I have a request. A Republic team has gone missing in that region.
Our top archaeologist, Doctor Kerrian, ignored the warnings and took an expedition into those "Nightmare Lands." We haven't heard from him since.
He must have been pursuing something important.
What was he studying?
He said the ruins might give important insight into ancient Voss society.
I will see what can be done.
Perhaps we can find them.
Thank you, Jedi, I was running out of options.
If his expedition has gone awry because he ignored the warnings, he has only himself to blame.
He doesn't deserve a rescue.
I can't condemn an entire team for one man's stupidity.
I need a guide. Landmarks are... changed. The Deep Cradle hides. Doctor Kerrian might know.
Where was his team heading?
If we can track him down.
You've known where to go up until now.
You're lost?
All looks improper.
Without Doctor Kerrian, we'll be walking in circles.
So we have no choice.
He filed an expedition proposal with his chosen campsite. I'll send you the location now.
Good luck, and please, don't take any risks out there.
Gaden-Ko will die if he's out there unprotected!
And of course the Voss were delighted when we bloodied those Gormak savages. Imperial training, you see.
How lovely. But my guest has arrived. So you may leave.
Of course. I'm sure one Jedi will make all the difference.
My apologies, he'd test a Kitonak's patience. Sophia Farash, Republic ambassador. What brings you to Voss, Master Jedi?
I need to speak with the Voss leaders about recruiting some Mystics to my cause.
An audience with the Voss.
Several worlds have united to fight the Empire, and we would like the Voss Mystics to help us.
I represent an alliance....
I want to leave this planet with a platoon of Mystics at my command.
Get me some Mystics.
You--what? I--I should explain. Sith Lords have taken entire systems to war to gain a single Mystic healer.
One Mystic visionary can change Voss culture with--with a word! And you want them as soldiers?
How can one person wield so much influence?
Mystics are that powerful?
No Mystic's prediction has ever been wrong. It's the foundation of Voss society.
Sorry, I misunderstood.
Getting Mystics on my side will be harder than I thought.
So that's a no.
Now, buying Voss-Ka and its mountain... that, I could negotiate.
Please understand, Mystics are rare--only a few are born in a generation.
And with the Gormak tribes expanding, there's even fewer. It's become too dangerous for potential Mystics to go on pilgrimage and finish their training.
Sorry, what are the Gormak?
The Gormak?
Local tribesmen who attack on sight. We offered to guard potential Mystics from them, but the Voss refused--to be honest, our troops would be outmatched.
Surely the Voss would be grateful if someone protected these young Mystics.
I could help those potentials.
If the Mystics are so important, the entire Voss army should be guarding their pilgrimage.
The Voss should protect them.
It hurts their pride that they can't. Unfortunately, the Gormak threat is too wide-scale.
The Voss are irrational about "interference" with the Mystics. Though they might be more accepting of a Jedi.
And if they saw you help a potential finish his training... but it's long odds. Only one in a dozen actually becomes a Mystic.
Among the potentials, who has the best chance of succeeding?
Any likely candidates?
If the Force is truly with us, failure is impossible.
They'll have a Jedi's help.
I hope you're right.
I could waste my time needlessly.
Long odds indeed.
Yet success would put Voss-Republic relations ahead twenty years.
Now, Athal-Je is gifted, but hasn't studied much. And Heen-Sa is sympathetic toward the Empire.
Or, there's Gaden-Ko. An acquaintance of mine, a potential visionary. If he becomes a Mystic, he's entitled to a huge entourage, including healers and Voss commandos.
Gaden-Ko might see me as interfering.
Will he want my help?
You'll need to ask him. But he's been petitioning to go on pilgrimage for years.
I'll ask for his consent.
This Gaden-Ko's gratitude could be valuable.
Good. A prophet and his army.
Havren? Please book a room at Bas-Ton's teahouse, and send an invitation to Gaden-Ko.
Sorry, Madam Ambassador. Gaden-Ko left Voss-Ka with his family group this morning.
He's gone without a real escort? They'll be killed out there! Jedi, you have to go after them!
He will have gone to the closest holy ground, a cave below the mountain. Oh, wait, the ritual....
Before you enter, cut branches from these trees here, and here. Their scent will make you pure enough to walk the holy ground.
I respect the Voss and their traditions, but is this really the time?
Trees? But lives are at risk.
If that's what it takes to reach Gaden-Ko and his family.
Very well.
Don't be ridiculous.
You're an outsider. If you go there unpurified, you'll offend the Voss and push them closer to the Empire.
Be careful. Away from Voss-Ka, the Imperials' manners tend to deteriorate.
